info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 2:22PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A Band Of Heavy Snow Showers To Impact The Connecticut River Valley... At 215 PM EST, an band of heavy snow showers was located from the northwest portion of Massachusetts to about 10 miles west of the border between Connecticut and New York. These snow showers were moving east at 30 mph, and will be moving across the Berkshires and Litchfield Hills and then into the Connecticut River Valley by 330 pm. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Hartford, West Hartford, Chicopee, Enfield, Westfield, Holyoke, Amherst, Windsor, Northampton, Agawam, West Springfield, South Windsor, Greenfield, Orange, Deerfield, Simsbury, Ludlow, Bloomfield and Gardner. The snow could accumulate at a rate of 1 inch in less than 30 minutes. Visibility will also drop below one quarter of a mile. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions, and consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of heavy snow. A rapid drop in temperatures with the snow showers may also lead to the rapid formation of black ice on area roadways. Please use extreme caution, especially on bridges, overpasses and around curves. Allow plenty of stopping distance and avoid braking suddenly.
